title: Amulet in the Form of Two Eyes
description:
Light blue faience eye-amulet in form of two eyes. Obverse and reverse flat with eyes painted in dark blue on obverse. Reverse plain. Pierced through lower center.

Condition: Glaze slightly worn on obverse.
credit_line: Gift of the Egypt Exploration Fund

museum_location.name: This item is not on view

completeness.name: Best
completeness.description: All data has been vetted. Objects generally have quality photos and descriptions.

labels.content: Ancient Egyptian mythology included a tale of the damaged and magically healed eye of Horus, or the so-called wedjat-eye. Following that myth, these two eyes symbolized health and physical well-being. They were thus meant to provide these benefits to the owner of the amulet. When used as a votive, the two eyes almost certainly represented the eyes of the deity to whom the offering was made in hope that the god would see and protect the patron.

collections.name: Egyptian, Classical, Ancient Near Eastern Art

exhibitions.title: Body Parts: Ancient Egyptian Fragments and Amulets
